intro: Graphorkis cochlearis, commonly known as the spiral orchid, is a species of orchid native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique spiral-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and come in shades of white, pink, and purple. Graphorkis cochlearis is a perennial herb that produces tubers, which help it survive in its natural habitat.
